org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage
Interface IAeQueueStorage

All Superinterfaces:
IAeStorage
All Known Implementing Classes:
AeQueueStorage
public interface IAeQueueStorage
extends IAeStorage

This interface defines the required methods for a persistent queue store. A persistent queue store is used by the persistent version of the Active BPEL queue manager.

Method Detail

findMatchingReceive

public AeMessageReceiver findMatchingReceive(AeInboundReceive aInboundReceive,
                                             IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback aAckCallback)
                                      throws AeStorageException
Finds and returns a persisted receive object that matches the inbound receive. Whether a receive object matches an inbound receive is determined by the following:
1) If the inbound receive is correlated, then the correlatesTo method is used to determine if the receive matches.
2) If the inbound receive is not correlated, then the matches method is used to determine if the receive matches.

If this method returns a non-null value, then a successful match has been made AND the inbound receive has been successfully journalled. This means that the caller can assume that they have exclusive rights to the message receiver.

Parameters:
aInboundReceive - The inbound receive object.
aAckCallback - durable invoke message acknowledge callback.
Returns:
A matching message receiver or null if not found.
Throws:
AeStorageException

storeReceiveObject

public void storeReceiveObject(AeMessageReceiver aReceiveObject)
                        throws AeStorageException
Stores a receive object in the persistent store.

Parameters:
aReceiveObject - A BPEL receive object.
Throws:
AeStorageException

removeReceiveObject

public AeMessageReceiver removeReceiveObject(long aProcessId,
                                             int aMessageReceiverPathId)
                                      throws AeStorageException
Removes a receive object from the persistent store.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The ID of the owning process.
aMessageReceiverPathId - The message receiver path id (xpath to a BPEL object).
Returns:
The receive queue object or null if not found.
Throws:
AeStorageException

getQueuedMessageReceivers

public AeMessageReceiverListResult getQueuedMessageReceivers(AeMessageReceiverFilter aFilter)
                                                      throws AeStorageException
Returns a selection of message receivers based on the filter criteria.

Parameters:
aFilter - Specifies matching criteria for receiver selection.
Returns:
The matching receivers. The AeMessageReceiverListResult will be empty if no matching rows are found.
Throws:
AeStorageException

getAlarms

public java.util.List getAlarms()
                         throws AeStorageException
Returns a list of all alarms that are saved in the store. This is used by the persistent alarm manager to initialize the alarms at engine startup.

Returns:
The list of stored alarms as IAePersistedAlarm objects.
Throws:
AeStorageException

getAlarms

public AeAlarmListResult getAlarms(AeAlarmFilter aFilter)
                            throws AeStorageException
Returns a list of alarms matching the passe filter.

Parameters:
aFilter - Filter for alarms to find.
Returns:
List of alarms matching the passed filter.
Throws:
AeStorageException

storeAlarm

public void storeAlarm(long aProcessId,
                       int aLocationPathId,
                       int aGroupId,
                       int aAlarmId,
                       java.util.Date aDeadline)
                throws AeStorageException
Stores an alarm in the store object. The alarm will be saved to some sort of medium, typically a database or other secondary storage.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The ID of the process this alarm should be sent to.
aLocationPathId -
aGroupId - The group id of the alarm.
aAlarmId - Alarm id.
aDeadline - The Date when this alarm should be triggered.
Throws:
AeStorageException

removeAlarm

public boolean removeAlarm(long aProcessId,
                           int aLocationPathId,
                           int aAlarmId)
                    throws AeStorageException
Deletes an alarm from the persistent storage. This will typically happen when the alarm is cancelled, but also when the alarm fires.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The ID of the process that owns the alarm.
aLocationPathId - The location path id of the BPEL object that owns the alarm.
aAlarmId - alarm execution referene id.
Returns:
True if the alarm was successfully deleted.
Throws:
AeStorageException

removeAlarmForDispatch

public long removeAlarmForDispatch(long aProcessId,
                                   int aGroupId,
                                   int aLocationPathId,
                                   int aAlarmId)
                            throws AeStorageException
Deletes an alarm from the storage for the purposes of dispatching the alarm to a process. This amounts to:
  1. Removing the alarm
  2. Removing all message receivers in the same group
  3. Journaling the alarm
  4. Returning the journal id
Returns the journal id of the journaled alarm (or NULL_JOURNAL_ID if the remove failed).

Parameters:
aProcessId -
aGroupId -
aLocationPathId -
aAlarmId -
Throws:
AeStorageException
